posts.content:
Hi, does anyone have any photos of Deluxe seats for a Turkish Bus? (1/3rd 2/3rds seats)

I was thinking of getting some TMI covers, has anyone bought a set?

I'm also on the lookout for a EsiCool door handle if anyone has one

Thanks

Jim

This will be a non reply....
I have only ever seen one Deluxe original bus (in Turkis as well) an ex Bus of the the year from the anals of SSVC history.... I was not allowed to take pictures.. it was completely untouched still with the Rosettes as it was driven into the garage from winning.....
This bus I tried to buy but did not succeed, belonging to a very unique Gentleman let's call him Keith....A very clever designer and patent holder....
He did sell me the Dormobile Front three bar rack and the home made rear...
The seat covers in the front were "tuck and roll" stitched not plain or heat seal seamed...so not like TWI covers at all....
Of course I have no idea if these were original covers or had been made for this bus!

I used TMI covers for Peebles and I am very pleased with them
I though maybe look on thesamba.com at the trim pages for deluxe upholstery pictures...I have just checked from the period where 1/3 2/3 were introduced all the pictures do show heat seamed covers... so I think these were non standard covers made for that award winning bus..

You need someone to send detailed pictures of their OG Deluxe 1/3 2/3 seat cover (with dims for the spacings if they are stitched)
My 62 Devonette had the OG stitched basalt grey cover on a hump back bench seat. I sent the old cover to Bromsgrove and Peter copied it exactly to make me some covers..It is finished waiting the body..

I had an easicool handle... Bobley gave me an easicool which was being retored...in bits..with the door converted to LHD..
I passed it forwards to Rippers....on a use or pass forwards basis for his LH OG Devon interior..
It was given to me (beer tokens involved - Bobley is such a gent...)
My LHD Devon interior came with OG Deluxe Turkis door cards. The Cargo door cupboard was still mounted to the card (and still is) when I bought it

Como Green TMI #324
Phosphor TMI #330

If you look on the TMI website you can find your way to working out the part number for the front 1/3 2/3 seats.
TMI only sell through agents.
Very few stockists over here..
All resellers


In other words..you place order over here..
They place order with TMI or another reseller in USA.

My choice would be to down load the electronic catalogue from TMI website...work out code for seat covers check with others who have ordered and have cover box label..
Then price up through Coolair VWH C&C ( yuk) etc. and then check price from Wolfsburgwest.com including shipping.
Then allow to pay 4.5% import duty and 20% VAT on top of that. They just stick their labels over TMI

My maths says may still be cheaper and I reckon faster...

Or Bromsgrove are TMI agents...Get them to quote to make snd fit in como.
They are very very busy though...So also a delay. They will not supply covers.
Spirit of the 50s will not use TMI...too expensive. ..He says.

Thanks, I've had a look at VWH & Cool Air. I'll have a look into the other options. Has anyone here ordered a set of Como covers?

Really appreciate it

Jim

Hi,

Do you know the colour/code for the Seat Piping to go with Como/Phosphor Green Covers from TMI, is it just called phosphor (K663)?

Thanks

Jim

I would look in thesamba.com Technical paint and upholstery to start....
Sounds like you did that.... that is what is in that list! But I have no idea what TMI call it or say...
Has anyone ordered any...
Maddison?
TMI answer the phone...but no luck with emails before...
G

Thanks Graham, just want to get them ordered.

Jim

Como Green.jpg (8.17 KiB) Viewed 355 times


Hi Graham,

Still no joy, have been in touch with WW and VW Heritage. Say they is no code for Phosphor piping?

Just want to order this combination. Has anyone ordered these or have an idea where I can get them?

Cheers

JIm
TMi do that combinationâ€¦.I have them in my bus (although mines a bench seat not the split seat combo)

Hi, thanks Maddison, I have been in touch with TMI, WW and VW Heritage.

VW Heritage...They do not know the code for the piping?
TMI does not give the option to add the piping colour?
WW.. will not confirm Shipping and taxes?
Cool Air... Have not got back to me?


Getting a bit frustrated. Need Covers and 2mtrs of Phosphor Materials asap.

Thanks again

Jim

WW will take order and then provide total bill for you to pay including shipping. USUALLY they ask for telephone contact details....provide a phone number.
They use someone like fed-ex.
When the items hit the UK fed-ex will contact you and say we have your items Import duty at 4.5% and VAT at 20% needs to be paid so items can be released through customs.
You pay by card on the phone and they deliver.
Best to do it this way or they try to deliver and demand payment on the door..
Dave was not amused when I arranged to have items delivered direct to him....or they deliver and then send you a letter for non payment and hound you till it is paid.

Have you tried phoning either TMI to ask what piping you could have fitted?
I would phone them direct...1/3 2/3 como seats..what piping colour?
Get TMI codes direct and then order from WW...
You will pay less $ for Â£ numbers but have to add shipping and then taxes on top.
G

Thanks, have emailed WW and will give them a call later.

Really appreciate it.

Jim

Hi Graham, sorry, yeah finally managed to get sorted thanks. Got in touch with both WW and TMI. The taxes and delivery were going to add an extra Â£150 to the order. After loads of calls and emails, VW Heritage finally sorted it for me (with the correct colour combo) They can loose the delivery and taxes because they ship it with other orders. Will let you know when they arrive.

Thanks again for all your help.

Jim
